revision.text: {{redirects|Corna}} {{multiple issues| {{more citations needed|date=June 2013}} {{more footnotes|date=May 2017}} {{Primary sources|date=August 2008}} }} [[File:Mano cornuta by-RaBoe001.jpg|thumb|upright|A demonstration of the sign of the horns.]] The '''sign of the horns''' (also known as '''metal horns''', '''devil horns''', '''rock horns''', and other names) is a gesture often used when listening to heavy metal. ==Spiritual and superstitious meaning== In [[Hinduism]], the hand gesture is known as the "[[List of mudras (yoga)#Hasta (hand mudras)|Apana yogic mudra]]."http://indianexpress.com/article/india/rajinikanth-politics-party-symbol-apana-mudra-detoxification-purification-5007863/ In [[Indian classical dance]] forms, the hand gesture symbolises the [[Asiatic lion#In mythology, religion, culture and art|Lion]]. In [[Buddhism]], it is seen as an [[Apotropaic magic|apotropaic]] gesture very commonly used by [[Gautama Buddha]] as "Karana Mudra" which is synonymous with [[Exorcism#Buddhism|expulsion of demons]] and removal of obstacles like sickness or negative thoughts. The [[apotropaic]] usage of the sign can also be seen in [[Italy]] and in other [[Mediterranean]] cultures where, when confronted with unfortunate events, or simply when these events are mentioned, the sign of the horns may be given to ward off bad luck. It is also used traditionally to counter or ward off the "[[evil eye]]" (''malocchio'' in Italian). In Italy specifically, the gesture is known as the ''corna''. With fingers pointing down, it is a common Mediterranean apotropaic gesture, by which people seek protection in unlucky situations (it is thus a more Mediterranean equivalent of [[knocking on wood]]). Thus, for example, the [[President of the Italian Republic]], [[Giovanni Leone]], shocked the country when, while in [[Naples]] during an [[outbreak]] of [[cholera]], he shook the hands of [[patient]]s with one hand while with the other behind his back he superstitiously made the ''corna'', presumably to ward off the disease or in reaction to being confronted by such misfortune. This act was well documented by the [[journalist]]s and [[photographer]]s who were right behind him, a fact that had escaped President Leone's mind in that moment. In Italy and other parts of the [[Mediterranean region]], the gesture must usually be performed with the fingers tilting downward to signify the warding off of bad luck; in the same region and elsewhere, the gesture may take a different, offensive and insulting meaning if it is performed with fingers upward or if directed aggressively towards someone in a swiveling motion (see section below). In Italy, one can also "touch iron" (''tocca ferro'') or touch one's nose to ward off bad luck. Males in Italy may also grab their [[testicle]]s when confronted by bad luck; however, this is considered more vulgar. In [[Peru]], one says ''contra'' (against). In the [[Dominican Republic]], the expression is ''zafa'', said against curses known as ''fukú''. All of these gestures are meant to conjure supernatural protection. The sign of the horns is used during religious rituals in Wicca, to invoke or represent the [[Horned God]].''Wicca: A Guide for the Solitary Practitioner'' by Scott Cunningham, p. 42. ==Offensive gesture== In many [[Mediterranean basin|Mediterranean]] and Latin countries, such as [[Argentina]], [[Brazil]], [[Chile]], [[Colombia]], [[Cuba]], [[France]], [[Greece]], [[Italy]], [[Portugal]], [[Spain]], [[Mexico]], [[Peru]], [[Ecuador]], [[Venezuela]] and [[Uruguay]],{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/travel/picturegalleries/8788932/Rude-hand-gestures-of-the-world.html?image=5 |title=Rude hand gestures of the world}}{{cite web |url=http://www.theloop.ca/living/funwind/photo-gallery/-/p/6407/-International-field-guide-to-rude-hand-gestures/2442503 |title=International field guide to rude hand gestures |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131214213945/http://www.theloop.ca/living/funwind/photo-gallery/-/p/6407/-International-field-guide-to-rude-hand-gestures/2442503 |archivedate=2013-12-14 |df= }}{{cite web |url=http://www.buzzle.com/articles/hand-gestures-in-different-cultures.html |title=Hand Gestures in Different Cultures}}{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=rHS39OG4GG4C |title=Rude Hand Gestures of the World: A Guide to Offending without Words By Romana Lefevre |isbn=9781452110172 |author1=Lefevre |first1=Romana |date=2011-10-21 }} when directed towards someone and swiveled back and forth, the sign implies [[cuckold]]ry; the common words for ''cuckolded'' in Italian, Greek and Spanish are {{lang|it|cornuto}}, {{lang|el|κερατάς}} ({{lang|el-Latn|keratas}}) and {{lang|es|cornudo}}, respectively, literally meaning "horned".{{cite web |url=http://www.reading-body-language.co.uk/gestures2.html |title=Hand Gestures Part Two — The Cuckold Gesture |publisher=Reading-Body-Language.co.uk}} During a [[European Union]] meeting in February 2002, then-current Italian prime minister [[Silvio Berlusconi]] was photographed performing this gesture behind the back of the Spanish foreign minister.{{cite web|url=http://content.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1874098_1874099_1874139,00.html|title=Top 10 Worst Silvio Berlusconi Gaffes|date=8 December 2012|publisher=|accessdate=21 May 2017|via=content.time.com}} ==Northwestern European and North American popular culture== ===Contemporary use by musicians and fans=== [[Marlon Brando]] makes the sign whilst singing "[[Luck Be a Lady]]" in the film ''[[Guys and Dolls (film)|Guys and Dolls]]'' (1955), seeming to indicate it was a sign for snake eyes in the craps game he is playing for the gamblers' souls.{{cite web|title=Marlon Brando-Luck Be a Lady|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f-JzdRJCcsg|website=youtube.com|accessdate=13 September 2017}} On the cover of [[the Beatles]]' ''[[Yellow Submarine (album)|Yellow Submarine]]'' album (1969), the cartoon of [[John Lennon]]'s right hand is making the sign above [[Paul McCartney]]'s head. Some fans interpreted this as one of the many supposed "[[Paul is dead]]" clues. Some may think it is possible that the cartoonist misrepresented the [[ILY sign|sign for "I love you"]], which is very similar and more in keeping with the band's public message and image. However, the 1969 cartoon is based on many photos of John Lennon making the hand sign in 1967. One of these photos of Lennon doing the hand sign appears on the cover of a Beatles single release shortly after, making it the first time the hand sign appears on a rock release.{{Citation needed|date=July 2018}} The back cover of the album ''[[Witchcraft Destroys Minds & Reaps Souls]]'' (1969) by Chicago-based psychedelic-occult rock band [[Coven (band)|Coven]] pictured band members giving the "sign of the horns". Starting in early 1968, Coven concerts always began and ended with singer [[Jinx Dawson]] giving the sign on stage.{{citation needed|date=December 2017}} The sign is also used in various Disney movies. It can be seen in the medieval-style opening sequence of the British-American Disney movie ''[[Bedknobs and Broomsticks]]'' (1971) as a goat-legged figure with a jester's cap, leading a procession of outlandish-looking figures, flashes the sign. Beginning in the early 1970s, the horns were known as the "P-Funk sign" to fans of [[Parliament-Funkadelic]]. It was used by [[George Clinton (musician)|George Clinton]] and [[Bootsy Collins]] as the password to the Mothership,{{cite web |url=http://www.lacitybeat.com/article.php?id=1216&IssueNum=66 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071122030548/http://www.lacitybeat.com/article.php?id=1216&IssueNum=66 |archivedate=November 22, 2007 |title=Odyssey of the Devil Horns |first=Steve |last=Appleford |publisher=Los Angeles City Beat |date=September 9, 2004 |quote=A friend arranges a meeting with Clinton. I hand him a photograph of Dio making the hand signal, and tell him this is the man (or one of them) credited with bringing it to rock. Clinton stares at the picture for a long, silent minute, breathing heavily. Another minute passes. He's never heard of Ronnie James Dio. It's the P-Funk sign, man.}} a central element in Parliament's science-fiction [[P-Funk mythology|mythology]], and fans used it in return to show their enthusiasm for the band. Collins is depicted showing the P-Funk sign on the cover of his 1977 album ''[[Ahh... The Name Is Bootsy, Baby!]]'' In 1977, a painting of [[Gene Simmons]] (of the band [[Kiss (band)|KISS]]) exhibits the sign on the cover of ''[[Love Gun]]'', the band's sixth studio album. Simmons still utilizes the sign, both on and off stage. [[Frank Zappa]] can be seen jokingly making the gesture in the film ''[[Baby Snakes]]'' (1979) in response to the audience, commenting, "That's right, spindle twice." For the Indian movie ''[[Rock On 2]]'' (2016), the sign of the horns is used to represent "2". ===Heavy metal culture=== [[File:Dio throwing Horns.jpg|thumb|Vocalist [[Ronnie James Dio]] making the sign at a [[Heaven & Hell (band)|Heaven and Hell]] concert in 2007. The gesture is quite common within [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] culture.]] [[Ronnie James Dio]] was known for popularizing the sign of the horns in [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]].{{cite web |url=http://www.ultimate-guitar.com/columns/junkyard/the_devils_horns_a_rock_and_roll_symbol.html |title=The Devil's Horns: A Rock And Roll Symbol |publisher=Ultimate-Guitar.com |date=September 7, 2005}} He claimed his Italian grandmother used it to ward off the [[evil eye]] (which is known in Southern Italy as ''[[Evil eye|malocchio]]''). Dio began using the sign soon after joining the metal band [[Black Sabbath]] in 1979. The previous singer in the band, [[Ozzy Osbourne]], was rather well known for using the [[V Sign|"peace"]] sign at concerts, raising the index and middle finger in the form of a V. Dio, in an attempt to connect with the fans, wanted to similarly use a hand gesture. However, not wanting to copy Osbourne, he chose to use the sign his grandmother always made.Ronnie James Dio interview in the 2005 documentary ''[[Metal: A Headbanger's Journey]]''. In the interview he also ridicules Gene Simmons for taking credit for originating use of the sign in heavy metal, attributing the claim to Simmons' well-known egotism. The horns became famous in metal concerts very soon after Black Sabbath's first tour with Dio. The sign would later be appropriated by heavy metal fans under the name "maloik", a corruption of the original ''malocchio''.{{citation needed|date=November 2015}} [[Geezer Butler|Terry "Geezer" Butler]] of Black Sabbath can be seen "raising the horns" in a photograph taken in 1971. The photograph is included in the CD booklet of the ''[[Symptom of the Universe: The Original Black Sabbath 1970–1978]]'' compilation album. This would indicate that there had been some association between the "horns" and heavy metal before Dio's popularization of it. When asked if he was the one who introduced the hand gesture to metal subculture, Dio said in a 2001 interview with Metal-Rules.com: {{quote|I doubt very much if I would be the first one who ever did that. That's like saying I invented the wheel, I'm sure someone did that at some other point. I think you'd have to say that I made it fashionable. I used it so much and all the time and it had become my trademark until the [[Britney Spears]] audience decided to do it as well. So it kind of lost its meaning with that. But it was.... I was in Sabbath at the time. It was a symbol that I thought was reflective of what that band was supposed to be all about. It's NOT the devil's sign like we're here with the devil. It's an Italian thing I got from my Grandmother called the "Malocchio". It's to ward off the Evil Eye or to give the Evil Eye, depending on which way you do it. It's just a symbol but it had magical incantations and attitudes to it and I felt it worked very well with Sabbath. So I became very noted for it and then everybody else started to pick up on it and away it went. But I would never say I take credit for being the first to do it. I say because I did it so much that it became the symbol of rock and roll of some kind.{{cite web |url=http://www.metal-rules.com/zine/index.php?option=content&task=view&id=666 |title=Dio - Interviewed By EvilG |publisher=Metal-Rules.com |date=March 9, 2001}}}} [[Gene Simmons]] of the rock group [[Kiss (band)|KISS]] attempted to claim the similar-looking but unrelated variation, the [[ILY sign]] (thumb extended rather than thumb toward the palm) hand gesture for his own. According to CBS News, "Simmons filed an application on Friday, June 16, 2017 with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for a trademark on the hand gesture he regularly uses during concerts and public appearances - thumb, index and pinky fingers extended, with the middle and ring fingers folded down. According to Simmons, this hand gesture was first used in commerce — by him — on Nov. 14, 1974. He is claiming the hand gesture should be trademarked for "entertainment, namely live performances by a musical artist [and] personal appearances by a musical artist." {{cite web |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/gene-simmons-trademark-devil-horns-hand-gesture/|title=Gene Simmons wants to trademark "devil horns" hand gesture|publisher=CBS News|date=June 15, 2017}} Simmons abandoned this application on June 21, 2017 {{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/legalentertainment/2017/06/21/breaking-gene-simmons-abandons-hand-gesture-trademark-application/#77f2bc74faac|title=Gene Simmons Abandons Hand Gesture Trademark Application |publisher=Forbes |date=June 21, 2017}} ===Neopaganism=== In [[Wicca]], the sign of the horns is used to represent the Horned God.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}} ===Electronic communication=== In text-based electronic communication, the sign of the horns is represented with the \../, \m/ , lml or |m| emoticon and sometimes with /../. The [[Unicode]] character U+1F918 🤘 SIGN OF THE HORNS was introduced in Unicode 8.0 as an [[emoji]], on June 17, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://unicode.org/versions/Unicode8.0.0/|title=Unicode 8.0.0|website=unicode.org|accessdate=21 May 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2015/06/burrito-sign-of-the-horns-and-35-other-emoji-approved-in-unicode-8-0/|title="Burrito," "Sign Of The Horns," and 35 other emoji approved in Unicode 8.0|publisher=|accessdate=21 May 2017}} ===Sports culture=== [[File:hookemhorns.jpg|thumbnail|A fan displays the Hook 'em Horns during a Texas football game versus Arkansas.]] [[Hook 'em Horns]] is the slogan and hand signal of the [[University of Texas at Austin]]. Students and alumni of the university employ a greeting consisting of the phrase "Hook 'em" or "Hook 'em Horns" and also use the phrase as a parting good-bye or as the closing line in a letter or story. The [[gesture]] is meant to approximate the shape of the head and horns of the [[University of Texas at Austin|UT]] mascot, the [[Texas longhorn (cattle)|Texas Longhorn]] [[Bevo (mascot)|Bevo]]. Fans of the [[University of South Florida]] Bulls use the same hand sign at their athletic events, except that the hand is turned around and facing the other way. With the middle and ring finger extending towards the person presenting the "Go Bulls" sign. Fans of [[North Dakota State University]] Bison athletics also use a similar hand gesture, known as "Go Bison!" The pinky and index fingers are usually slightly bent, however, to mimic the shape of a [[bison]]'s horns. Fans of [[North Carolina State University]] Wolfpack athletics use a similar gesture with the middle and ring fingers moving up and down over the thumb to mimic a wolf's jaw. Fans of [[University of California, Irvine]] Anteaters use a similar sign with the middle and ring fingers out to resemble the head of the mighty anteater. Fans of [[University of Nevada, Reno]] [[Nevada Wolf Pack|Wolf Pack]] athletics use a similar sign with the middle and ring fingers out to resemble the wolf's snout. Fans of [[University of Utah]] athletics, particularly football and gymnastics, use a gesture where the index and pinky finger are straight and parallel to each other, forming a block "U."{{cite web|url=http://www.alumni.utah.edu/muss/membership/ |title=MUSS - Student Cheer Section for the U of U Utes - University of Utah Alumni Association | MUSS |publisher=Alumni.utah.edu |date=2011-03-18 |accessdate=2012-08-13}} Fans of [[Northwestern State University]] Demon athletics also use a similar hand gesture, known as "Fork 'em!" The pinky and index fingers are extended but a little more parallel to each other resembling the horns on a demon. [[Arizona State University]] [[Arizona State Sun Devils|Sun Devils]] fans make a pitchfork sign by extending the index and middle fingers, as well as the pinky. The thumb holds down the ring finger to complete the gesture. The same gesture is used by fans of the [[Wichita State University|Wichita State]] [[Wichita State Shockers|Shockers]], which in this context represents a stylized "W". Fans of the [[Grand Canyon University]] Antelopes use this hand gesture with a slight variation by touching the tips of the ring and middle finger with the thumb to form the shape of an antelope and its horns. Often followed by the phrase "Lopes up". Fans of the [[Universidad de Chile]] soccer team use this gesture to represent their support for the team by forming a U-shaped hand gesture, often followed by the phrase "Grande la U". Retired professional wrestler [[Edge (wrestler)|Edge]] often used the Corna gesture during the later phase of his career, wherein he would raise both his hands in the very same gesture, which would result in his [[Pyrotechnics|pyro]] going off. == See also == * [[Hook 'em Horns]], hand signal of the University of Texas * [[ILY sign]] is sometimes confused with this gesture because many users tend to do the "horns" improperly by extending their thumb. * [[Shaka sign]] * [[Cornicello]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Horn gestures}} *[http://www.rockandrollconfidential.com/archives/archives_death.php Rock and Roll Confidential on their logo] *{{cite news |url=http://www.chartattack.com/news/31464/ronnie-james-dio-re-claims-the-devil-horns |first=Neil |last=Haverty |date=2002-05-30 |title=Ronnie James Dio Re-Claims the Devil Horns |publisher=''[[Chart (magazine)|Chart]]'' |accessdate=2009-09-27 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091003114135/http://www.chartattack.com/news/31464/ronnie-james-dio-re-claims-the-devil-horns |archivedate=2009-10-03 |df= }} *[https://georgewbush-whitehouse.archives.gov/news/releases/2005/01/images/20050120-1_p44294-227-515h.html President George W. Bush, gestures the "Hook 'em, horns," the salute of the University of Texas Longhorns.(...)] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20071122030548/http://www.lacitybeat.com/article.php?id=1216&IssueNum=66 Odyssey of the Devil Horns: Who is responsible for bringing metal's famous hand signal to the tribe?] ''[[Los Angeles CityBeat]]'', Sept. 9, 2004 {{Gestures}} {{Superstitions}} {{Rock festival}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sign Of The Horns}} [[Category:Hand gestures]] [[Category:Heavy metal subculture]] [[Category:Superstitions of Italy]] [[Category:Symbols]] [[Category:Mediterranean]]

page.title: Significant acts of violence against LGBT people

revision.text:
{{Synthesis|date=February 2011}} This is a list of notable [[homophobic violence]],<ref name="youtube.com">{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kf9Um8A0EXE&oref=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kf9Um8A0EXE&has_verified=1|title=DENÚNCIA! TRAVESTI DANDARA ASSASSINADA A SOCOS E PAULADAS EM FORTALEZA|website=YouTube|language=en|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> e.g. attacks on victims thought by the attacker to be [[lesbian]] or [[gay]] and attacked for [[homophobic]] motives.
See [[list of unlawfully killed transgender people]] for homicides of [[transgender]] people.
==Australia== * In 1972, George Duncan and Roger Jones were thrown into a river by a group of men believed to be police officers, [[Murder of George Duncan|resulting in Duncan's death]]. Jones refused to identify their attackers out of fear for his life. A group of officers were charged but acquitted, and the case is said to be the subject of a government cover-up. A police report describing it as the result of a "'high-spirited frolic' that went wrong".<ref>http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2002/07/15/1026185159689.html</ref> * In January 1987, Raymond Keam was killed in Alison Park, Randwick, Sydney. His injuries were consistent with attackers having jumped on his chest while he lay on the ground.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/nsw/bashing-victims-lengthy-wait-for-justice-and-change-20130728-2qsnr.html|title=Bashing victim's lengthy wait for justice and change|last=Feneley|first=Rick|date=2013-07-29|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|access-date=2017-09-25|language=en-US}}</ref> * In December 1988, Scott Johnson's body was found at the bottom of a 50-metre cliff near Blue Fish Point around Manly. There have been many investigations into the cause of this death.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-12-16/scott-johnson-saga-from-the-80s-to-now/8120902|title=Timeline: Scott Johnson saga from the '80s to now|date=2016-12-16|work=ABC News|access-date=2017-09-25|language=en-AU}}</ref> The police had historically described his death as suicide, but a 2017 inquest — the third on his death — admitted he was murdered in an anti-gay hate crime.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2017/nov/30/scott-johnson-was-most-likely-murdered-in-gay-hate-attack-inquest-rules|title=Scott Johnson was victim of gay-hate attack, inquest rules|date=30 November 2017|publisher=The Guardian}}</ref> * In January 1989, Richard Johnson was lured to a toilet block in Alexandra Park where he had left his phone number on the wall where he was gang bashed to death.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/national/now-theyre-40something-will-bondis-gaybashing-gangs-dob-in-killers-for-100000-20150623-ghv7b3.html|title=Now they're 40-something, will Bondi's gay-bashing gangs dob in killers for $100,000|last=Feneley|first=Rick|date=2015-06-23|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|access-date=2017-09-25|language=en-US}}</ref> * In July 1989, after a night drinking with friends on Oxford Street, Ross Warren's keys were found at the base of the cliffs at Tamarama, his car was nearby. His body was never found.<ref name=":0" /> * In November 1989, John Russell was found at the bottom of Marks Park with a clump of hair in his hand. Police found no suspicious circumstances.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/nsw/memorial-planned-in-bondi-for-sydneys-gay-hate-victims-20160525-gp38yx.html|title=Memorial planned in Bondi for Sydney's gay hate victims|last=Benny-Morrison|first=Ava|date=2016-05-25|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|access-date=2017-09-25|language=en-US}}</ref> * In December 1989, David McMahon was attacked in Bondi while jogging in the same place another was attacked a couple days before. He says he clearly remembers them saying, "let's throw him off where we threw the other one off."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.who.com.au/david-mcmahon-reveals-how-he-escaped-murder|title=David McMahon reveals how he "escaped murder"|access-date=2017-09-25}}</ref> * In May 1990, William Wayne Tonks, a teacher at Cleveland Street High, was found dead in his Artarmon home.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/nsw/sydney-shame|title=Sydney's Shame|website=The Sydney Morning Herald|access-date=2017-09-25}}</ref> * In July 1990, Kritchikorn Rattanajurathaporn was attacked with a hammer and staggered off a cliff in Bondi. Three men were convicted of his murder in the early 1990s.<ref name=":1" /> * On December 3, 2007 [[Craig Gee]] was attacked by four men whilst holding his boyfriend's hand walking down Crown Street in [[Surry Hills]], [[Sydney, Australia]]. Part of his skull was reduced to powder and his leg was broken during the attack.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=7569|title=Sorry, we can't help you|publisher=[[Sydney Star Observer]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706112331/http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=7569|archivedate=2011-07-06|df=}}</ref> This incident prompted a vigil against the rising level of [[homophobia]] in the city and apathy from police,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=7699|title=Vigil Attracts Huge Crowd|publisher=Sydney Star Observer|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706112336/http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=7699|archivedate=2011-07-06|df=}}</ref> and despite the attack, Gee and his boyfriend joined the Chief of Parade [[Margaret Cho]] to lead the 2008 [[Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras]] parade.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=7885|title=Bashing Victims to Lead Parade|publisher=Sydney Star Observer|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706112340/http://www.ssonet.com.au/display.asp?ArticleID=7885|archivedate=2011-07-06|df=}}</ref> * Several of the victims of the [[Snowtown murders]] were openly gay men, while others were labeled by the killers as being gay and/or child abusers. Prosecutor Wendy Abraham suggested the accused men's attitude to paedophiles and homosexuals was a motive.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/law-order/how-australias-worst-serial-killers-john-bunting-and-robert-wagner-stained-snowtown-with-their-sadistic-kill-games/story-fni0ffnk-1226924311490 |title=How Australia’s worst serial killers John Bunting and Robert Wagner stained Snowtown with their sadistic kill games |last1=Anderson |first1=Paul |last2= |first2= |date=21 May 2014 |website=heraldsun.com.au |publisher=Herald Sun |access-date=19 August 2016 |quote=}}</ref> * [[Suicide of Tyrone Unsworth|A gay teenager Tyrone Unsworth killed himself]] after prolonged homophobic bullying at his school, which culminated with his being hospitalized after his jaw was struck with a fence used as a weapon by another boy. *Roffee and Waling (2016) conducted a study that aimed to investigate incidents of bullying, harassment and violence committed towards LGBTIQ people. They discovered an issue, however, when they found that many people did not view what they had been subjected to as a hate crime, or even a crime at all. Furthermore, many of the participants commented on feeling that they did not meet the criteria of being a victim of harassment, bullying or violence. This established that prospective participants may not have felt that they met the criteria and thus would not have elected to take part in the study. The conclusion of the study established that all of the participants had been subjected to some form of victimisation, with some of the attacks being extremely violent and criminal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/306325028_Resolving_ethical_challenges_when_researching_with_minority_and_vulnerable_populations_LGBTIQ_victims_of_violence_harassment_and_bullying|title=James Roffee & Andrea Waling Resolving ethical challenges when researching with minority and vulnerable populations: LGBTIQ victims of violence, harassment and bullying}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|title=James Roffee & Andrea Waling Rethinking microaggressions and anti-social behaviour against LGBTIQ+ Youth | doi=10.1108/SC-02-2016-0004 | volume=15 | journal=Safer Communities | pages=190–201}}</ref>
==Brazil== {{main|homophobic violence in Brazil}} * On June 10, 2006, the burnt bodies of Edivaldo Silva de Oliveira and Jeovan Bandeira, were found in the back of a car in Bahia, Brazil.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://noticias.terra.com.br/brasil/professores-gays-carbonizados-em-carro-levam-cidade-do-sertao-baiano-as-ruas,aafd716469f0b3ef46439e499847b368gtfabtna.html|title=Professores gays carbonizados em carro levam cidade do sertão baiano às ruas|work=Terra|access-date=2017-06-21|language=pt-BR}}</ref> * [[Osvan Inacio dos Santos]], 19, was attacked and murdered in September 2007 on a street near a bar where he had just won the local "Miss Gay" competition in the town of Batingas in northeast [[Brazil]]. Dos Santos' naked body was found on Sunday morning and forensic examination found his skull had been fractured and indicated sexual assault.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.pinknews.co.uk/news/articles/2005-5494.html|title=Gay beauty contest winner murdered|date=September 19, 2007|publisher=[[Pink News]]}}</ref> * [[Alexandre Peixe dos Santos]], Brazilian gay rights activist, was attacked and beaten in February 2008 at the offices of [[Sao Paulo]]'s Gay Pride Association in [[Brazil]]. Activists estimate that more than 2,680 gay people were murdered in [[Brazil]] between 1980 and 2006.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.pinknews.co.uk/news/articles/2005-6830.html|title=Gay rights leader attacked in Brazil|date=February 12, 2008|publisher=Pink News}}</ref> * [[Alexandre Thome Ivo Rajao]], only 14 when he was brutally tortured and murdered in 2010, whilst on the way home from watching the South African World Cup at a friend's house. Many believe this attack to be motivated by homophobia as Alexandre had been in a same-sex relationship with the cousin of one of the attackers.<ref>http://m.revistaladoa.com.br/2014/06/noticias/while-you-celebrate-world-cup-brazilian-mother-remembers-her-worst-nightmare-and</ref> * On June 16, 2016, 21-year-old Gabriel Figueira Lima was stabbed in the neck and left to die.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://g1.globo.com/am/amazonas/noticia/2016/06/travesti-morre-apos-golpe-de-faca-no-pescoco-em-manaus-diz-policia.html|title=Travesti morre após golpe de faca no pescoço em Manaus, diz polícia|date=2016-06-17|work=Amazonas|access-date=2017-06-21|language=pt-BR}}</ref> * On June 24, 2016, the body of Wellington Júlio de Castro Mendonça was found northwest of Rio and he was allegedly stoned to death.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://avozdaserra.com.br/noticias/jovem-encontrado-morto-em-olaria-pode-ter-sido-vitima-de-homofobia|title=Jovem encontrado morto em Olaria pode ter sido vítima de homofobia|date=2016-06-24|work=Jornal A Voz da Serra|access-date=2017-06-21|language=pt-br}}</ref> * Ágatha Mont, 26 (male university student found strangled in Itapevi, São Paulo after being threatened for using the women's restroom);<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2017/02/04/21635/|title=ÁGATHA MONT / 26 ANOS / ESTRANGULADA / SP, ITAPEVI|date=2017-02-04|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> Mirella de Carllo, 39, a transvestite and winner of the 2016 global T-Girl award was found strangled to death;<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nlucon.com/2017/02/querida-nas-redes-sociais-travesti.html|title=Querida nas redes sociais, travesti Mirella de Carlo é assassinada em BH|work=NLUCON|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> Emanuelle Muniz, 21 who had been preparing for a sex change kidnapped and murdered in Annapolis, GO, by a blunt to the head with a stone;<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2017/02/26/emanuele-21-anos-go-anapolis/|title=EMANUELLE MUNIZ / 21 ANOS / APEDREJADA / GIH / GO, ANAPOLIS|last=GGB|date=2017-02-26|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://g1.globo.com/goias/noticia/2017/02/transexual-morta-se-preparava-para-mudanca-de-sexo-diz-delegado.html|title=Transexual morta se preparava para mudança de sexo, diz delegado|date=2017-02-28|work=Goiás|access-date=2017-06-21|language=pt-BR}}</ref> Hérika Izidoro, 24;<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nlucon.com/2017/04/a-ultima-lagrima-da-travesti-herica.html|title=A última lágrima da travesti Hérica Izidoro, espancada, jogada de viaduto e morta|work=NLUCON|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> Michelly Garcia, 25; and Jennifer Celia Henrique, 37; Lexia Alves de Brito, 30; Camila Albuquerque, 20; Bruna Tavares, 17, were all violently killed on account of their sexual identity.<ref>{{Cite development|last=OAS|date=2009-08-01|website=www.oas.org|language=en|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> * On June 27, 2016, Antonio Kvalo was beaten for being gay in Rio de Janeiro.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://emais.estadao.com.br/noticias/comportamento,brasil-confronta-epidemia-de-violencia-antigay,10000061599|title=Brasil confronta epidemia de violência antigay - Emais - Estadão|work=Estadão|access-date=2017-06-21|language=pt-BR}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytsyn.com/images/photos/1413156.html|title=New York Times Syndicate|website=www.nytsyn.com|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> Kvalo created a website named Tem Local?<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://temlocal.com.br/|title=Tem Local?|website=Tem Local?|language=pt-BR|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> for people to document instances of LGBTI violence.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressreader.com/usa/san-francisco-chronicle-late-edition/20160706/281547995215181|title=PressReader.com - Connecting People Through News|website=www.pressreader.com|access-date=2017-06-21}}</ref> * Dandara dos Santos, a transgender woman, was tortured and then stoned to death by five men and it was captured on video on February 15, 2017.<ref name="youtube.com"/><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/03/08/world/americas/brazil-transgender-killing-video.html|title=Torture and Killing of Transgender Woman Stun Brazil|last=Phillips|first=Dom|date=2017-03-08|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-06-21|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> * On February 19, 2017, a 20-year-old university student, Marcos Valdevino was punched in the face in public in Olinda, Pernambuco, while waiting for his friends to arrive.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://oglobo.globo.com/sociedade/jovem-homossexual-faz-desabafo-apos-ter-sido-agredido-em-olinda-20953996|title=Jovem homossexual faz desabafo após ter sido agredido em Olinda|date=2017-02-20|work=O Globo|access-date=2017-06-21|language=pt-BR}}</ref>
==Canada== *[[Kenneth Zeller]], a gay man in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]] who was employed as a schoolteacher, was murdered by five young offenders in [[High Park]] in 1985. The incident spurred the [[Toronto District School Board]] to implement a program to combat anti-gay discrimination and violence — culminating in the creation of the [[Triangle Program]], Canada's first [[alternative school]] program for at-risk LGBT youth, in 1995.<ref>Alanna Mitchell, "Welcome to Canada's gay high school: Toronto's Triangle program offers an educational refuge". ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'', May 29, 2004.</ref> *On March 19, 1989, Joe Rose, a young gay activist in [[Montreal]], was [[stabbing|stabbed]] to death by a gang of teenagers who targeted him for having pink hair. The incident later inspired educator Michael Whatling, who had been a classmate of Rose's at the time of his death, to publish ''[[A Vigil for Joe Rose]]'', an exploration of the struggles faced by LGBT students.<ref>[http://pre2010.thelinknewspaper.ca/articles/1887 "High school homos"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120725222205/http://pre2010.thelinknewspaper.ca/articles/1887 |date=2012-07-25 }}. ''[[The Link (newspaper)|The Link]]'', November 17, 2009, p. 8.</ref> *On August 21, 1989, Alain Brosseau, a straight man in [[Ottawa]], was attacked by a gang of teenagers who wrongly assumed him to be gay, while walking home from his job at the [[Château Laurier]].<ref name=brosseau>[http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/story/2009/08/21/ottawa-alain-brosseau-ceremony.html "Gay-targeted murder recalled 20 years later"]. [[CBC News]], August 21, 2009.</ref> The attackers chased him through [[Major's Hill Park]] to the [[Alexandra Bridge]], and then threw him off the bridge resulting in his death.<ref name="brosseau"/> This resulted in a gay and lesbian community outcry and eventually led to the formation of the [[Ottawa Police Service]]'s GLBT Liaison Committee two years later.<ref name=brosseau /> * [[Aaron Webster]], a gay man in [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], was beaten to death with baseball bats and pool cues on November 17, 2001 in a part of [[Stanley Park]] known for [[Cruising for sex|cruising]]. Ryan Cran, along with two unidentified youths, was convicted of manslaughter in Webster's death. Cran was paroled in February 2009 after serving four years of a six-year sentence.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/canada/british-columbia/story/2009/02/05/bc-arron-webster-ryan-cran-released.html |title=Gay community troubled by release of killer in Stanley Park death |work=CBC News |date=February 5, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090416164904/http://www.cbc.ca/canada/british-columbia/story/2009/02/05/bc-arron-webster-ryan-cran-released.html |archivedate=April 16, 2009 |df= }}</ref> * Conner Copeman, 20 of [[Cumberland, British Columbia]] was assaulted in [[Saskatoon, Saskatchewan]] on July 11, 2007 by a group of men in a park in the city's [[Buena Vista, Saskatoon|Buena Vista]] neighbourhood. Copeman had recently moved to the city, and confessed to police that he was flirting with some men, who later attacked him. Copeman was found laying in the street six blocks east of the park, with a broken neck. Copeman ended up a [[quadriplegic]] as a result of his injuries.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/paralyzed-man-helps-police-reopen-assault-case-1.1184996|title=Paralyzed man helps police reopen assault case|df=}}</ref> * Jordan Smith, 27, of [[White Rock, British Columbia]], was assaulted on September 27, 2008 by 20-year-old Michael Kandola of Vancouver. Smith was holding hands with another male while walking in Vancouver's [[Davie Village]], an area frequented by [[GLBTQ]] individuals, when Kandola started following the pair with four to five of his friends and began shouting anti-gay obscenities towards the gay pair. Kandola confronted the two and punched Smith on the side of his head, knocking him unconscious. Smith required surgery for his injuries. Kandola was charged with assault causing bodily harm, and police sought to invoke Canadian hate-crime legislation against Kandola. A [[Facebook]] group with over 4000 members was established petitioning for a minimum life imprisonment sentence for Kandola.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.canada.com/vancouversun/story.html?id=c8585fc3-b8af-4d0a-8280-e80bff7d48da|title=Vancouver Police Seek Hate Charge|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120311011108/http://www.canada.com/vancouversun/story.html?id=c8585fc3-b8af-4d0a-8280-e80bff7d48da|archivedate=2012-03-11|df=}}</ref> On April 30, 2010, the assault was deemed by the B.C. Supreme Court to be a hate crime and Kandola was sentenced to 17 months in jail.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/canada/british-columbia/story/2010/04/30/bc-kandola-sentence.html#ixzz0oV9OD0hD |title=BC gay basher gets 17-month sentence |work=CBC News |date=April 30, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100504132600/http://www.cbc.ca/canada/british-columbia/story/2010/04/30/bc-kandola-sentence.html |archivedate=May 4, 2010 }}</ref> * Anji Dimitriou and Jane Currie were physically assaulted on November 3, 2008 at an [[Oshawa]], [[Ontario]] public school while waiting to pick up their children. Mark Scott, the attacker, punched both women in the face, referring to them as "men", "fucking dyke bitches" and spit in Dimitriou's face. He was in court in January 2009, for two counts of assault causing bodily harm.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://network.nationalpost.com/np/blogs/toronto/archive/2008/12/09/no-hate-charges-in-attack-on-oshawa-lesbians.aspx|title=No hate charges in attack on Oshawa lesbians}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20081112/oshawa_attack_081112/20081112/|title=Lesbians seek hate crime charges after attack}}</ref> However, the incident was prosecuted as a simple assault and not as a [[hate crime]], as Scott neither advocated [[genocide]] nor incited anyone else to join in the attack.<ref>[https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/article/550852 "No hate crimes charges in lesbian assault"], ''[[Toronto Star]]'', December 9, 2008.</ref> *On March 13, 2009, Shawn Woodward was charged with aggravated assault after physically attacking 62-year-old Ritchie Dowrey in [[Vancouver]]'s [[Fountainhead Pub]], allegedly because "He's a faggot. He deserved it."<ref>Jeremy Hainsworth, [http://www.xtra.ca/public/Vancouver/Community_members_demand_court_treat_Fountainhead_gaybashing_as_a_hate_crime-6519.aspx "Community members demand court treat Fountainhead gaybashing as a hate crime"]. ''[[Xtra! West]]'', March 26, 2009.</ref> Dowrey had briefly bumped into Woodward's shoulder, which the heterosexual Woodward characterized during his trial as a predatory sexual advance.<ref name=woodwardguilty>[https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/british-columbia/man-found-guilty-in-vancouver-gay-bashing-case/article1669511/ "Man found guilty in Vancouver gay-bashing case"]. ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'', August 11, 2010.</ref> Although Dowrey survived the assault, he suffered serious and permanent brain damage, and spent the entire rest of his life living in care facilities until his death in 2015.<ref>[http://www.theprovince.com/life/tragic+Ritch+Dowrey+victim+violent+2009+West+bashing+dies/10779164/story.html "'A tragic day': Ritch Dowrey, victim of violent 2009 West End gay bashing, dies"]. ''[[The Province]]'', February 2, 2015.</ref> At Woodward's trial, Justice Jocelyn Palmer rejected the allegation that Dowrey had groped Woodward, ultimately finding that "[Woodward's] intention was to deny, deflect and dissemble. He fabricated this story to justify his outrageous assault."<ref name=woodwardguilty /> *On October 18, 2010, the home of a gay couple in [[Little Pond, Prince Edward Island|Little Pond]], [[Prince Edward Island]] was [[firebombing|firebombed]].<ref>[http://www.cbc.ca/canada/prince-edward-island/story/2010/11/03/pe-human-rights-defend-gay-couple.html "Support grows for gay fire victims"]. [[cbc.ca]], November 4, 2010.</ref> Both men escaped the fire unharmed, but their home was destroyed. In late October and November, a series of rallies and fundraising concerts was held in both Little Pond and [[Charlottetown]] to support the couple and to oppose homophobic violence.<ref>[http://www.xtra.ca/public/National/Gay_couple_burned_from_PEI_home-9470.aspx "Gay couple burned from PEI home"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101129024734/http://www.xtra.ca/public/National/Gay_couple_burned_from_PEI_home-9470.aspx# |date=2010-11-29 }}. ''[[Xtra!]]'', November 24, 2010.</ref> *On April 17, 2012, [[Halifax Regional Municipality|Halifax]] gay activist Raymond Taavel was beaten to death outside Menz & Mollyz, a gay bar on the city's Göttingen Street, by Andre Denny, a paranoid schizophrenic on an unsupervised leave from a nearby forensic hospital for those found Not Criminally Responsible for previous unlawful activity, after attempting to break up a fight between Denny and another man.<ref name=taavel>[http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/story/2012/04/21/ns-taavel-fundraiser.html "Fundraiser planned in memory of N.S. gay activist"]. [[CBC News]], April 21, 2012.</ref> Taavel was a former chair of [[Halifax Pride]], the city's [[gay pride]] festival, and a former editor at the LGBT magazine ''[[Wayves]]'' and the spiritual magazine ''[[Lion's Roar (magazine)|Lion's Roar]]''.<ref name=taavel /> Over 1,000 people attended a vigil in Taavel's memory later the same evening, which included performances by poet [[Tanya Davis]], actor and writer Stewart Legere and singer-songwriters [[Rose Cousins]] and [[Ria Mae]].<ref>[http://www.xtra.ca/public/National/Haligonians_gather_to_remember_Raymond_Taavel-11859.aspx "Haligonians gather to remember Raymond Taavel"]. ''[[Xtra!]]'', April 17, 2012.</ref> Although there were unconfirmed allegations that Denny used anti-gay slurs while attacking Taavel,<ref name=taavelreleased>[http://news.nationalpost.com/2012/04/18/man-accused-of-murdering-gay-activist-raymond-taavel-should-never-have-been-released-lawyer/ "Man accused of murdering gay activist Raymond Taavel should never have been released: lawyer"]. ''[[National Post]]'', April 18, 2012.</ref> to date media and the police have not asserted that the case clearly constituted a hate crime, generally attributing the attack to Denny's mental illness rather than to a specifically anti-gay bias.<ref name=taavelreleased /> Ironically, Taavel had previously survived a more clearly anti-gay physical attack, which he wrote about in ''Wayves'' in May 2010.<ref>[http://news.nationalpost.com/2012/04/17/halifax-murder-victim-raymond-taavel-had-a-lovely-joyous-presence/ "Halifax murder victim Raymond Taavel had a ‘lovely, joyous presence’"]. ''[[National Post]]'', April 17, 2012.</ref> *On September. 30, 2012, [[New Westminister, British Columbia]]: January Marie Lapuz, 26, was found in her home in the 500 block of Third Avenue around 10 p.m. Sept. 30, 2012 suffering from stab wounds. She died the next morning at Royal Columbian Hospital. Charles Jameson Neel, 22, pleaded guilty to manslaughter in June in her stabbing death and was sentenced to eight years in prison. Lapuz was the first transgender person on the executive of Sher Vancouver, an organization supporting gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender South Asians. She was named the organization's social coordinator, according to its website in 2012.<ref name=lapuz_nwnl>[http://www.newwestnewsleader.com/news/277964361.html"New Westminster transgendered [sic] woman's killer gets eight years" ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129063835/http://www.newwestnewsleader.com/news/277964361.html |date=2014-11-29 }}. [[new west news leader]], Oct 2, 2014.</ref><ref name=lapuz_ctv>[http://bc.ctvnews.ca/guilty-plea-in-killing-of-transgender-woman-in-new-westminster-1.1860355"]. [[CTV News]], June 9, 2014.</ref> *On October 12, 2013 Scott Jones, a gay resident of [[New Glasgow, Nova Scotia|New Glasgow]], [[Nova Scotia]], was stabbed by a knife-wielding man after leaving the Acro Lounge.<ref name=jones>[http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/scott-jones-says-he-was-attacked-for-being-gay-1.2459289 "Scott Jones said he was attacked for being gay"]. [[CBC News]], December 11, 2013.</ref> He was left [[paraplegic]] by the attack.<ref name=jones /> His attacker, Shane Matheson, was found guilty and sentenced to 10 years in prison in June 2014.<ref name=matheson>[http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/scott-jones-says-he-forgives-his-attacker-shane-edward-matheson-1.2673052 "Scott Jones says he forgives his attacker, Shane Edward Matheson"]. [[CBC News]], June 12, 2014.</ref> During his recovery, Jones participated in the creation of Don't Be Afraid, a province-wide campaign to combat homophobia,<ref name=halifaxpride>[http://dailyxtra.com/canada/news/halifax-pride-names-scott-jones-grand-marshal "Halifax Pride names Scott Jones grand marshal"]. ''[[Xtra!]]'', July 6, 2014.</ref> and was selected as the grand marshal of the 2014 [[Halifax Pride]] parade.<ref name=halifaxpride /> He was profiled in the 2018 documentary film ''[[Love, Scott]]''.<ref>[http://www.cbc.ca/radio/thecurrent/the-current-for-april-27-2018-1.4637146/after-surviving-attack-scott-jones-chronicles-the-lifelong-process-of-forgiveness-1.4637282 "After surviving attack, Scott Jones chronicles the 'lifelong process' of forgiveness"]. ''[[The Current (radio program)|The Current]]'', April 27, 2018.</ref>
==Chile== * [[Daniel Zamudio]], [[Chilean people|Chilean]] [[gay]] man who was tortured and murdered in [[Santiago]] in 2012 after his attackers learned of his [[sexual orientation]].<ref name="The Week 2013">The Week, "International News: Hate Crime Punished," November 8, 2013.</ref> After his murder he has become a symbol against [[Violence against LGBT people|homophobic violence]] in Chile, and his death and all the media attention contributed to accelerating legislation against discrimination, as well as opening new doors of acceptance and tolerance of differences in the conservative country.
==Croatia== * 30 participants at a [[gay pride]] event in [[Croatia]] were attacked by multiple assailants on July 7, 2007. The attackers had also prepared [[Molotov cocktail]]s but were stopped by the police before using them. Many people taking part in Gay Pride marches in [[Eastern Europe]] (e.g.: [[Romania]], [[Russia]], [[Serbia]]) have been beaten after leaving the marches.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2007/10/30/europe/EU-GEN-Croatia-Hate-Crime.php|title=Croat charged with hate crime for attempting to attack gay parade|publisher=[[International Herald Tribune]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mywire.com/pubs/AFP/2007/07/07/3921947?extID=10051|title=Violence at Croatian Gay Pride march}}</ref>
==France== [[File:Wilfred De Bruijn wounded - Same-sex Marriage in France.JPG|thumb|Wilfred De Bruijn on April 7, 2013.]] * Francois Chenu was murdered (beaten and drowned) by [[white power skinhead|neo-Nazi skinheads]] on September 13, 2002, in Reims, France. The murder became the subject of the documentary ''[[Beyond Hatred]],'' which includes extended interviews with members of Francois' family during and after the trial. As depicted in the documentary, one of the assailants was a minor, who received a 15-year sentence, while two adult attackers received 20-year sentences. The parents of the 15-year-old also received 6-month sentences for their neglect, contributing to their son's violence. * [[Bertrand Delanoë]], the openly gay mayor of [[Paris]], was non-fatally stabbed by a Muslim immigrant, Azedine Berkane, in October 2002. * Alexis Frumin was murdered June 9, 2007 in [[Reims]] by white power skinheads motivated by hatred of his ethnicity and sexual orientation.<ref>http://www.lunion.presse.fr/article/marne/affaire-frumin-un-crime-raciste-et-homophobe</ref> * Wilfred de Bruijn was beaten while walking with his boyfriend in the [[19th arrondissement of Paris]] on April 7, 2013. de Bruijn later posted a photograph of his badly injured face on [[Facebook]] to raise awareness of homophobic attacks, attracting international media attention in the process.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/04/10/wilfred-de-bruijn-france-gay-attack-_n_3055836.html | work=Huffington Post | title=Anti-Gay Attack Victim Becomes French Icon | date=April 10, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2307288/Paris-gay-attack-victim-Wilfred-Bruijns-Facebook-injuries-picture-goes-viral.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title='This is the true face of homophobia': Gay man viciously beaten in Paris posts picture of his injuries to Facebook in protest move that has now gone viral}}</ref> The attack was led by an ethnic gang.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.liberation.fr/societe/2014/06/03/prison-ferme-pour-deux-des-agresseurs-d-un-couple-gay_1032056 | location=Paris | work=Libération | title=' Prison ferme pour deux des agresseurs d'un couple gay '}}</ref>
==Iraq== * In 2005, the [[Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani]] issued a [[fatwa]] on his website calling for the execution of gays in the "worst, most severe way". Following protests from UK-based Iraqi gay rights groups, Sistani agreed to remove the fatwa from his website except for the section calling for the punishment of lesbianism. In January 2007, a [[United Nations]] report described the increased persecution, torture and extrajudicial killing of Iraqi lesbians and gay men by the [[Shia]] [[death squads]] of the [[Badr Organization|Badr]] and [[Sadrist Movement|Sadr]] militias (the armed wings of the two main Shia parties that control the government of Iraq).<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/iraqi-police-killed-14yearold-boy-for-being-homosexual-476917.html|title=Iraqi police 'killed 14-year-old boy for being homosexual'|publisher=[[The Independent]] | location=London|first=Jerome|last=Taylor|date=May 5, 2006}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/18/world/middleeast/18baghdad.html?_r=1&oref=slogin|title=Gays Living in Shadows of New Iraq|publisher=[[New York Times]] | first=Cara|last=Buckley|date=December 18, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.pinknews.co.uk/news/politics/2005-1476.html|title=Iraqi Ayatollah removes gay fatwa|publisher=Pink News}}</ref>
==Ireland== * Charlie Self, a 33-year-old set designer at the TV network [[RTÉ]] and a well-known member of the gay community in Dublin, was stabbed fourteen times in his apartment on 21 January 1982. Nobody has been brought to justice for the killing. It has been alleged in the press that homophobia on the part of the police may have led to a lack of willingness to pursue justice against Self's killer. In 2011 the case was reinvestigated as part of a cold cases review.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/irish-news/garda-homophobia-played-a-part-in-the-failure-to-solve-case-26748125.html|title=Garda homophobia played a part in the failure to solve case|first=Jim|last=Cusack|date=3 July 2011|work=Irish Independent}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thejournal.ie/cold-case-gardai-may-be-close-to-solving-rte-murder-156525-Jun2011/|title=Cold case: Gardaí may be close to solving RTÉ man's murder|work=thejournal.ie|date=15 June 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.herald.ie/news/two-fresh-leads-as-cold-case-team-open-rte-killing-27980422.html|title=Two fresh leads as cold case team open RTE killing|first=Ken|last=Foy|work=TheHerald.ie|date=20 May 2011}}</ref> * [[Declan Flynn]] was beaten to death in [[Fairview, Dublin|Fairview Park]], [[Dublin]], in 1983. The murder and subsequent suspended sentences of the perpetrators who pleaded guilty to murder saw the emergence of a more vocal gay community in the aftermath.<ref name="Scanlan2006">{{cite book|author=Margaret Scanlan|title=Culture and Customs of Ireland|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bAKGzfpyWxMC&pg=PA84|date=1 January 2006|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=978-0-313-33162-6|pages=84}}</ref><ref name="Ferriter2010">{{cite book|author=Diarmaid Ferriter|title=Occasions of Sin: Sex and Society in Modern Ireland|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=pUoWRaGQgRkC&pg=PA499|date=9 July 2010|publisher=Profile Books|isbn=1-84765-258-1|page=499}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/lifestyle/attitudes-may-have-changed-but-gaybashing-still-happens-29358960.html|title=Attitudes may have changed but gay-bashing still happens|first=John|last=Meagher|work=Irish Independent|date=21 June 2013}}</ref> * In January 1999, American expatriate writer Robert Drake was left permanently brain damaged after being assaulted by two men, Glen Mahon and Ian Monaghan, whom he had let into his home in [[Sligo]]. Drake was targeted because of his sexual orientation. The story of the attack and Drake's subsequent recovery became the subject of the 2013 documentary ''Where I Am''.<ref>http://www.phillymag.com/g-philly/2013/07/05/qfest-film-preview-making-where-am/</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.independent.ie/regionals/sligochampion/news/drake-to-return-to-sligo-to-make-documentary-27583506.html | work=Irish Independent | title=Drake to return to Sligo to make documentary | date=December 1, 2012}}</ref> * TV personality [[Mark O'Neill (TV personality)|Mark O'Neill]] and his partner came under a bloody attack from a [[gay bashing]] gang while walking on Patrick Street in Dublin in 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.herald.ie/entertainment/around-town/rtes-mark-bloodied-in-gay-bash-gang-attack-2073850.html|title=RTÉ's Mark bloodied in 'gay bash' gang attack|date=22 February 2010|accessdate=22 February 2010|last=O'Keeffe|first=Alan|newspaper=Evening Herald}}</ref> * TV presenter [[Brendan Courtney]] was battered by a [[gay bashing]] stranger while walking home down South Great George's Street in Dublin in 2011. A man in his early twenties punched him in the face and shouted "[[queer]]" before running away. Courtney said it was "disgraceful" that such an incident could occur in Dublin.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/lifestyle/independent-woman/celebrity-news-gossip/tv-star-back-on-feet-after-attack-2538072.html|title=TV star back on feet after attack|date=13 February 2011|accessdate=13 February 2011|newspaper=Sunday Independent}}</ref> He told ''[[Liveline]]'' that more than 50 other gay people had told him of their own experiences of being assaulted or verbally abused in towns nationwide.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.herald.ie/entertainment/around-town/brendan-overwhelmed-by-support-after-attack-2540618.html|title=Brendan overwhelmed by support after attack|date=15 February 2011|accessdate=15 February 2011|author=Murphy, Claire|newspaper=Evening Herald}}</ref>
==Israel== * Three marchers in a [[Jerusalem gay pride parade|gay pride parade in Jerusalem]] on June 30, 2005 [[Jerusalem gay pride parade#2005 attack|were stabbed]] by [[Yishai Shlisel]], a [[Haredi Judaism|Haredi Jew]]. Shlisel claimed he had acted "in the name of God". He was charged with attempted murder.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/4653655.stm|title=Man charged over Jerusalem attack|publisher=[[BBC News]]|date=July 5, 2005|accessdate=April 9, 2010}}</ref> * [[2009 Tel Aviv gay centre shooting]] * On 30 July 2015, [[Jerusalem gay pride parade#2015 attack|five marchers were injured and one marcher was killed]], again by [[Yishai Shlisel]] when he stabbed them. It was three weeks after he was released from jail.
==Jamaica== * [[Brian Williamson]], Jamaican gay rights activist, was murdered on June 5, 2004 in [[Kingston, Jamaica|Kingston]]. His killer, Dwight Hayden, who used a [[machete]] to stab and chop him some 70 times, pleaded guilty<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.jamaica-gleaner.com/gleaner/20060504/news/news2.html|title=Man pleads guilty to murdering gay activist|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110812003458/http://jamaica-gleaner.com/gleaner/20060504/news/news2.html|archivedate=2011-08-12|df=}}</ref> and received a life sentence.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.asylumlaw.org/docs/sexualminorities/JamaicaUSCountRep030607.pdf|title=Country Reports on Human Rights Practices – 2006|publisher=Bureau of Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor|date=March 6, 2007}}</ref> * An alleged gay man was chased down a [[pier]] by a Jamaican mob in December 2005. The man, fearful of the crowd, jumped into the water and drowned.<ref name="jamaica">{{cite news|url=http://www.gaywired.com/article.cfm?section=66&id=18055|title=Gay Men in Jamaica Attacked by Mob}}</ref> * An alleged gay student was attacked during a student riot in April 2006 at the [[University of the West Indies]] in Jamaica.<ref name="jamaica" /> * A group of gay men, including gay-rights activist Gareth Williams, were stoned by a mob in [[Mandeville, Jamaica]] on February 14, 2007. Their attackers reportedly had earlier demanded that the men leave the community.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://direland.typepad.com/direland/2007/02/jamaica_gay_lea.html|title=Jamaica: Gay Leader Escapes St. Valentine'S Day Lynch Mob|publisher=[[Direland]]}}</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite news|url=http://www.pinknews.co.uk/news/law/2005-6735.html|title=Homophobic mob attack Jamaican gay men|publisher=Pink News}}</ref> * During the funeral of a gay man in [[Mandeville, Jamaica]] on April 8, 2007, approximately 100 men gathered outside the church where 150 people were attending. According to mourners, the crowd broke the windows with bottles and shouted, "We want no battyman [gay] funeral here. Leave or else we’re going to kill you. We don’t want no battyman buried here in Mandeville." <ref name="jamaica"/> * Three gay men were attacked in the privacy of their dwelling in January, 2008 by an angry mob who had days before threatened them if they did not leave the community in Mandeville. According to reports, two men were hospitalised, one with serious injuries, while another man is still missing and feared dead.<ref name="jamaica" /><ref name="autogenerated1" />
==Martinique== *In 1964, American composer [[Marc Blitzstein]] was murdered in a homophobic attack by three sailors.<ref>{{Cite book |title=The Rest Is Noise |first=Alex |last=Ross |authorlink=Alex Ross (music critic) |page=383 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1-oK8NhvLNYC&pg=PA383 |publisher=Macmillan |year=2007}}</ref>
==Mexico== * May 22, 2016 reports indicate that at least five, and up to fifteen people are believed to have been killed in a mass shooting at La Madame. Three gunmen entered the Xalapa gay bar and carried out a mass shooting. Although the state prosecutor issued a statement noting that five people were killed, and were 14 injured, contradictory reports suggest there were many more deaths. Although police are searching for the gunmen, no arrests have been made.
==New Zealand== * [[Jeff Whittington]], a supposedly gay teenager, was beaten, kicked, and stomped to death by two men who reportedly later boasted of beating up a "[[faggot (slang)|faggot]]". The murder took place in [[Wellington]], [[New Zealand]], on May 8, 1999. Whittington's attackers, Jason Morris Meads and Stephen James Smith, were sentenced to life in prison.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/national/20087|title=Tax scam run from Rimutaka Prison}}</ref>
==Norway== * [[Magne Andreassen]] was murdered on August 21, 1992 in [[Lillehammer]]. The police investigation took about a year before [[Faust (musician)|Bård Faust]], the drummer of the band [[Emperor (band)|Emperor]], was tried and convicted of the killing. He was released from prison in 2002.<ref name="decibel">{{Cite news|url=http://decibelmagazine.com/Content.aspx?ncid=103042|title=Emperor – In the Nightside Eclipse|publisher=[[Decibel Magazine]]|accessdate=2009-01-14}}</ref><ref> {{Cite book|last=Kahn-Harris|first=Keith|title=Extreme metal: music and culture on the edge|volume=1|pages=45–46|publisher=Berg Publishers|publication-date=2007|isbn=1-84520-399-2|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=9--qAVrfxukC|year=2007}}</ref>
==Portugal== * ''Gisberta Salce Júnior'', more commonly known in [[Portugal]] as the Gisberta case, was a homeless [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] transsexual immigrant, who was [[HIV positive]], had drug problems, and was a sex-worker. She was found dead on 22 February 2006 inside a pit 10 metres deep, in an unfinished building in [[Porto]], the second biggest Portuguese city. The crime was confessed to by a group of 14 boys, between the ages of 10 and 16 years old, most of whom came from a child protection institution belonging to the Catholic Church, although financed by the state. From this confession, details of the dreadful act became known. The victim had a deeply fragile health condition, and these boys frequently harassed, insulted, and chased her. On the 19th, a group of these boys entered the unfinished and abandoned building where Gisberta was staying, tied her up, gagged and assaulted her with extreme violence, kicking her and beating her up with sticks and stones. The group also confessed to having introduced sticks into Gisberta's anus, whose body presented great injuries, and to having abandoned her at the scene. Her body also had cigarette-burn marks. On the 20th and 21st, they returned to the scene and repeated the aggressions. By dawn, from the 21st to 22nd, they finally threw her into the pit, attempting to hide the crime.<ref>[http://tgeu.org/gisberta-campaign-2006/ Gisberta Campaign (2006), Transgender Europe, 26.05.2017]</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ilga.org/news_results.asp?LanguageID=1&FileCategory=6&FileID=823|title=Transexual Murdered in Portugal|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091030055245/http://www.ilga.org/news_results.asp?LanguageID=1&FileCategory=6&FileID=823|archivedate=2009-10-30|df=}}</ref>
==Serbia== * Participants of the first [[Gay pride parade#Belgrade|Serbian Pride Parade]] in [[Belgrade]] on June 30, 2001 were attacked by hundreds of Serbian [[nationalist]]s, [[skinhead]]s, and soccer hooligans.<ref name="Serbia">{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/1415789.stm|title=In pictures: Belgrade gay march clashes|publisher=BBC News|date=June 30, 2001|accessdate=2009-01-15}}</ref>
==Sierra Leone== * [[FannyAnn Eddy]] was the most prominent [[Sierra Leone]]an gay and lesbian rights activist, working for Sierra Leone Lesbian and Gay Association (SLLGA) which she had founded in 2002, and had addressed the [[United Nations]] on lesbian and gay issues in her country during the discussion on the [[Brazilian Resolution]]. On September 28, 2004 Eddy was murdered while working alone in the [[Freetown]] SLLGA office. It is believed up to three men took part in the attack.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.hrw.org/legacy/english/docs/2004/10/04/sierra9440_txt.htm|title=Sierra Leone: Lesbian Rights Activist Brutally Murdered}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/3716768.stm|title=Sierra Leone gay activist killed|publisher=BBC News | date=October 5, 2004}}</ref> Sierra Leone Police Force said that the murder could not be blamed on [[homophobia]], and dismissed the claim that she had been raped, or that there was more than one attacker. The one suspect that had been captured escaped from police custody before trial and has not been recaptured or prosecuted. Human rights activists are unclear whether this was a hate crime or not, but regard her attack by one or more individuals in the offices of SLLGA as significant. They have asked why only one suspected attacker was captured, expressed concern over repeated delays in prosecution, and how the suspect was able to escape custody.<ref name="EDDY">{{cite web|url=http://www.iglhrc.org/cgi-bin/iowa/article/takeaction/resourcecenter/374.html|title=Alleged Fannyann Eddy Murderer Reportedly Escapes Police Detention in Sierra Leone|publisher=IGLHRC|date=4 Oct 2005}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iglhrc.org/cgi-bin/iowa/article/takeaction/resourcecenter/388.html|title=Sierra Leone: Clarification on the Murder of Fannyann Eddy|publisher=IGLHRC|date=Oct 4, 2004|accessdate=2010-07-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afrol.com/articles/15308 |title=Sierra Leone lesbian activist murder "not a hate crime"|publisher=Afrol.com|accessdate=2010-07-31}}</ref> In 2007 the [[Hirschfeld Eddy Foundation]] for the human rights of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) people was established in [[Berlin]]; the name is a combination of Eddy and [[Magnus Hirschfeld]]'s names.
==South Africa== {{See also|Corrective rape|Lesbophobia}} * Two people were injured when Blah Bar, a gay bar in [[Cape Town]], [[South Africa]], was bombed in November 1999.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/507805.stm|publisher=BBC News|title=Bomb blast in gay clubland|date=November 6, 1999|accessdate=April 9, 2010}}</ref> * [[Sizzlers massacre]] was a massacre that took place on January 20, 2003 at a gay massage parlour in [[Cape Town]], [[South Africa]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/horror-of-sizzlers-massacre-to-be-laid-bare-207259|title=Horror of Sizzlers massacre to be laid bare {{!}} IOL News|access-date=2017-12-10|language=en}}</ref> Nine men were brutally butchered to death and only one victim managed to escape. It was described by the High Court Judge and local police as one of the most vicious and bloodiest massacres the city of Cape Town had ever seen. * In [[Johannesburg]], [[Gauteng]], between 2011 and 2012 there were a number of serial killings that targeted 8 gay men who were murdered in their homes in strikingly similar circumstances. The men were all found with their hands tied behind their backs and there was no forced entry. The police made a statement saying It was believed that these men were targeted by a gang using online dating websites <nowiki/>in pretending to hook up with their victims and obtaining the trust of their victims who'd allow them into their homes.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://ewn.co.za/2013/04/18/Serial-killers-claim-9th-gay-victim|title=Serial killers claim 9th gay victim|last=News|first=Eyewitness|access-date=2017-12-10|language=en}}</ref> To this day, the case still remains a mystery.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/crime-courts/gautengs-gay-serial-murder-mystery-1249585|title=Gauteng’s gay serial murder mystery {{!}} IOL News|access-date=2017-12-10|language=en}}</ref>
==Spain== * [[Julio Anderson Luciano]] and his [[fiancé]] [[Isaac Ali Dani Peréz Triviño]] were killed on January 13, 2006 in the home they shared with Peréz Triviño's mother in the Spanish city of [[Vigo]]. Jacobo Piñeiro Rial, who stabbed them 22 and 35 times, respectively, then set fire to the home, was sentenced to 20 years imprisonment for [[arson]] and later was [[acquitted]] by a regional jury of murder charges on a "[[gay panic]]" defense,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.typicallyspanish.com/news/publish/article_20321.shtml|title=Self confessed killer of two gay men gets 20 years for starting a fire|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301184522/http://www.typicallyspanish.com/news/publish/article_20321.shtml|archivedate=2012-03-01|df=}}</ref> and on July 12 of 2010, Piñeiro walked out of jail a free man. However, on September 26 a second jury found Piñeiro guilty of both murders as well as setting their place on fire and on October 14, 2010, he was sentenced to 58 years in jail, minus time already served (the maximum allowed time for this type of crime).
==St. Maarten== * Richard Jefferson, senior producer of ''[[CBS Evening News]]'', and Ryan Smith, producer-researcher of ''[[48 Hours (TV series)|48 Hours]]'', both [[United States|American]], were severely beaten with a [[tire iron]] on April 6, 2006 outside the Sunset Beach Bar on the [[Caribbean]] island of [[St. Maarten]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sfbaytimes.com/index.php?sec=article&article_id=4911 |publisher=[[San Francisco Bay Times]] |title=CBS Producers Gay-Bashed On Vacation in Caribbean |accessdate=14 July 2013}}</ref> Three men and one woman were convicted and sentenced to prison for the attack, which was ruled a hate crime.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iglhrc.org/cgi-bin/iowa/article/takeaction/resourcecenter/302.html |title=St. Maarten: Tribunal Decision On Attack Against Two Gay Tourists |publisher=IGLHRC|date=Nov 20, 2006 |accessdate=2010-07-31}}</ref>
==Turkey== * Ahmet Yıldız, a gay man, was shot to death on July 15, 2008 in [[İstanbul]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ataman|first1=H.|last2=Cengiz|first2=O.K.|url=http://www.rightsagenda.org/attachments/523_T%C3%BCrkiyedeNefretSu%C3%A7lar%C4%B1.pdf|title=İnsan Hakları Gündemi Derneği|publisher=Türkiye'de nefret suçları|year=2009|accessdate=July 8, 2010|language=Turkish}}</ref>
==Uganda== * [[David Kato]], a prominent [[Uganda]]n gay rights activist, was beaten to death in his home on January 27, 2011. Mr. Kato had recently appeared on the front page of an anti-gay newspaper under the headline "Hang Them". Gay rights activists believe he was murdered for this reason, though the police say he was the victim of theft, not a hate crime.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/28/world/africa/28uganda.html?_r=1&hp|title=Ugandan Gay Rights Activist Is Beaten to Death|first=Jeffrey|last=Gettleman|publisher=The New York Times|date=January 27, 2011|accessdate=2011-01-27}}</ref>
==United Kingdom==
===England and Wales=== {{See also|History of violence against LGBT people in the United Kingdom}} * Kenneth Crowe, an English schoolteacher, aged 37, was found dead on 31 July 1950 in Rotherham, wearing his wife's clothes and a wig. He had approached a minor on his way home from the pub, who upon discovering Crowe was male, beat and strangled him.<ref name="MINER1">{{Cite news|title='Thought Man Was Woman' Story: Charge Is Now Murder|publisher=[[News of the World]]|date=5 Nov 1950}}</ref> John Cooney was found not guilty of murder and sentenced to five years for manslaughter.<ref name="MINER2">{{Cite news|title=He Killed Man Who Dressed As a Woman|publisher=News of the World|date=26 Nov 1950}}</ref> * [[George Brinham]], an English trade unionist, was killed in November 1962 in his flat by a young man, who claimed that Brinham had propositioned him. The killer was found not guilty of murder and manslaughter on the grounds of "provocation".<ref>"Youth cleared of Brinham manslaughter", ''[[The Guardian]]'', 22 January 1963</ref> * Christopher Schliach, a [[barrister]] who was gay, was murdered in his home in September 1989; he was stabbed more than 40 times.<ref name="LONUNS2" /> * Henry Bright, a [[hotel manager|hotelier]] who was gay, was stabbed to death at his home in December 1989.<ref name="LONUNS2" /> * William Dalziel, a hotel porter who was gay, was found unconscious on a roadside in Acton, west London in January 1990. He died from severe head injuries.<ref name="LONUNS2" /> * Michael Boothe, an actor who was gay, died in April 1990 in west London, beaten to death by a gang of up to six men close to a public lavatory.<ref name="LONUNS1" /> The police said he had been the victim of "an extraordinarily severe beating, of a merciless and savage nature". He managed to give a description of his attackers before he died, and a reward of [[£]]15,000 was offered, but no one was caught,<ref name="LONUNS2">{{Cite news|last=Richardson|first=Colin|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2002/aug/14/gayrights.comment|title=The worst of times|publisher=[[The Guardian]]|date=14 August 2002|location=London}}</ref> and the crime remains unsolved. The police review identified institutional homophobia within the [[Metropolitan Police]] as a factor.<ref name="LONUNS3">{{Cite news|last=Muir|first=Hugh|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2007/may/15/gayrights.ukcrime|title=Officers' homophobia hampered murder investigations, says review|publisher=The Guardian|date=15 May 2007|location=London}}</ref> * [[Colin Ireland]], age 43, was jailed for life in 1993 for murdering five gay men. Ireland picked up the men at pubs in London, and then killed them in their own homes.<ref name="LONUNS1">{{Cite news|first=Jason|last=Bennetto|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/gay-rights-a-matter-of-pride-for-the-metropolitan-police-552104.html|title=Gay Rights: A matter of pride for the Metropolitan Police?|publisher=Independent|date=5 July 2004|accessdate=9 April 2010|location=London}}</ref> A [[Scotland Yard]] review showed that Ireland's capture was hampered by institutional homophobia within the Metropolitan Police.<ref name="LONUNS3" /> * Andrew Collier, a housing warden, aged 33, was one of Ireland's victims; the murder was classified as homophobic and linked with the death of Peter Walker, Ireland's first victim. The report said the police could have done more to warn the community of the links between the murders.<ref name="LONUNS3" /> * Emanuel Spiteri, age 41, was strangled to death in his flat in Catford by Ireland, after meeting in a pub in Earls Court, west London.<ref name="LONUNS3" /> * Robyn Brown, a 23-year-old trans sex worker, was found stabbed to death in her flat in London on 28 February 1997. The original report described her as being 23-year-old Gemma Browne, formerly James Darwin Browne.<ref name="GEMMA">{{Cite news|last=Graham|first=Polly|title=TV Nicky's DNA tested in hunt for tranny-killer; Watchdog start to help probe over stab death|publisher=[[Sunday Mirror]]|page=19|date=27 April 2003}}</ref> The case went cold for over ten years, but her killer, James Hopkins, was eventually caught; in January 2009 he was jailed for life.<ref name="YPROB">{{cite news|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/news/Transsexual-39was-killed-by-.4867222.jp|title=Transsexual 'was killed by a Jamaican'|publisher=[[Yorkshire Evening Post]]|date=13 January 2009}}</ref><ref name="METROB">{{cite news|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/news/article.html?Killer_of_transexual_prostitute_jailed_for_life&in_article_id=498266&in_page_id=34|title=Killer of transexual prostitute jailed for life}}</ref> The report found that identifying her to the public using different names may have hampered attempts to connect with relevant communities.<ref name="LONUNS3" /> [[File:AdmiralDuncan.jpg|thumb|upright|London gay pub bombing in 1999 killed three and injured 70]] * In May 1999, the [[Admiral Duncan pub|Admiral Duncan]], a gay [[pub]] in [[Soho]] was bombed by former [[British National Party]] member [[David Copeland]], killing three people and wounding at least 70.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/special_report/1999/05/99/the_nail_bomb_terror/333913.stm|title= Thousands remember Soho dead|publisher=BBC News|date= 2 May 1999}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lgf.org.uk/news/1092/590/The-Admiral-Duncan-Bombing---10-years-on/|title=The Admiral Duncan Bombing – 10 years on|publisher=[[The Lesbian and Gay Foundation (UK)]]|date=30 April 2009}}</ref> * Jaap Bornkamp, a 52-year-old florist, was knifed in a homophobic attack in south-east London in June 2000; the murder remains unsolved despite the police displaying 20 ft by 10 ft images of [[CCTV]] footage taken near the murder scene. He was attacked after leaving a night club, and the police are reported as saying there was no confrontation or argument, but that the attack was homophobic and unprovoked.<ref name="LONUNS1" /> The report found this case to have been a model of police good practice.<ref name="LONUNS3" /> * [[Damilola Taylor]] was attacked by a local gang of youths on 27 November 2000 in Peckham, south London; he bled to death after being stabbed with a broken bottle in the thigh, which severed the femoral artery. The BBC, Telegraph, Guardian and Independent newspapers reported at the time that during the weeks between arriving in the UK from [[Nigeria]] and the attack he had been subjected to bullying and beating, which included homophobic remarks by a group of boys at his school. "The bullies told him that he was gay."<ref name="BBCDAM">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/1048449.stm|title=Damilola's grieving father speaks out|publisher=BBC News|date=30 Nov 2000}}</ref> He "may not have understood why he was being bullied at school, or why some other children taunted him about being 'gay' – the word meant nothing to him."<ref name="GUADAM" /> He had to ask his mother what 'gay' meant, she said "Boys were swearing at him, saying lots of horrible words. They were calling him names."<ref name="GUADAM">{{Cite news|last=Hopkins|first=Nick|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2000/nov/29/ukcrime.nickhopkins|title=Death of a schoolboy|newspaper=The Guardian|date=29 Nov 2000|location=London}}</ref> His mother had spoken about this bullying, but the teachers failed to take it seriously. "She said pupils had accused her son of being gay and had beaten him last Friday."<ref name="INDAM">{{Cite news|last=Bennetto|first=Jason|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/his-mother-told-teachers-he-was-being-bullied-now-she-must-bury-him-622144.html|title=His mother told teachers he was being bullied. Now she must bury him| newspaper=Independent|date=29 Nov 2000|location=London}}</ref> Six months after the murder, his father said, "I spoke to him and he was crying that he was being bullied and being called names.
